definitions: a heavy club with a spiked or flanged metal head, used in medieval warfare
a ceremonial staff carried as a symbol of authority
a chemical spray used in self-defense to temporarily incapacitate an attacker
the dried outer covering of a nutmeg seed, used as a spice
examples: The knight carried a mace into battle.
The mayor wielded a ceremonial mace.
She used mace for personal protection.
Mace is often used in baking.
